title: Rather than spending so much time trying to fix Mordekaiser's Bugs...
body:
Give him a high priority spot on the VGU list.
Rework him ground up rather than trying to fix 160+ Bugs in the mess that is his code.

This is upsetting me for a reason I didn't expect. I thought that all of these would be gameplay bugs that impact him in a significant way. The vast majority of these are basically his ghost being buggy with passives and animation or sounds not playing correctly. The way you and other players made it sound it is presented it as if he had 160+ direct gameplay bugs which is kind of disingenuous like #9 is literally saying his Q doesnt do a 1 /2 /3 anymore. This needs to be separated to show actual gameplay bugs animation and sound bugs and ghost specific bugs. There are definitely a hell of a lot of gameplay bugs thats for sure but the way it's presented just upsets me. Like number 34 isnt a bug at all it's just a statement that he has a passive he cant use on aram. quite a few champs have useless things on aram.

Edit: You could cut this number down by over 40 hell I'd be willing to waver even cut it in half just by stating that his ghost isn't applying passives correctly. Listing every single champion passive is just fluff. The W E and Q bugs were eye opening. Also some of these could be undocumented changes that happened when they patched him.

Correct me if I'm wrong, but I feel Morde's greatest weakness is his melee power **without** a gapcloser.

A lot of chimps nowadays have insane dueling power with a gap closer. What separates Morde from them, in my mind, is that Riot wanted to nail a thematic where he uses others for his dirty work (W & R), but also being able to do it himself (Q & E).

As you said, it might just be better to scrap (hehehehe) his kit, but keep the concept. A lord of metal, who mostly wants others to do his work, but can do it himself.

Worker: "Sir, there seems to be some cracks in the dam."

Manager: "Eh, fuck it, just rebuild the whole damn thing."

Worker: "Sir, the damn is popping in and out of existence, and it's almost entirely in shambles. There's also only a handful of operators that can somehow manage to make it function _but_ only the right conditions."

Manager: "What the f.... Who did this, who let this happen?!?"

See the problem?

Worker: "Sir, there seems to be other more dire cracks in other dams, not to mention the inner workings of those dams are more apt to damage the environment should they be used."

Manager: "Nah, fuck it, this one only has cracks. Some of them aren't even cracks, just chalk lines that look like cracks, so we're doing this one first."

(I enjoy this way of communication)
